channel.title: Get domain of IP
channel.description:
Is there a service to find out the domain name of a website(s) based on an IP address in the domains DNS records?
I don't want to reverse dns or whois an ip, I want to know the actual website(s) pointing to this IP.
ps, the IP is 66.240.163.51 registered to ultrahosting.com, but is clearly a client of the host because it comes up with someones shitty private server status checker.

item.title: Get domain of IP
item.dc:creator: @inertia inertia
item.description:
@inertia wrote:

Mopman:

how do you know they have a domain at all?

I don’t, but it’s worth a try I guess.

c|p:

you can attempt making an AXFR request to whatever nameserver handles that domain to get a list, but i really doubt that ultrahosting’s nameserver allows that (it’s a pretty rare occurrence to find a nameserver that allows public AXFR nowadays).

How would I try to do that?

Read full topic
